papers.title: Towards Compact Short FEL Sources : Seeding and LWFA based FEL
authors: Max Planck Institute for the Science of Light
proposed to improve the FEL temporal coherence and to enable more compact schemes
progressed significantly during this last decade. After conventionnal laser sources
eventually doubled or tripled in crystal
high order harmonics generated in gas were successfully used
bringing FELs in the XUV range. We are now involved in the demonstration of a new scheme

using fiber based tunable ultraviolet source. Its output power and tunability are of high interest. Last results obtained with the MaxPlanck Institute and the SPARC teams are presented. Seeding can lead to complex dynamics between the electron and the light pulse. Numerical studies revealed possible pulse splitting effects. We will report on their possible observation in collaboration with the FERMI team. Future FELs may also rely on emerging accelerators generated by laser wakefiled acceleration. Recently
